result.execSummary:
The defendant Melinda Joy Juleen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs in this matter. 
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
3) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $25 per month until paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant Melinda Joy Juleen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Melinda Joy Juleen.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was set for a plea/sentencing hearing.  Atty Chapman updates the Court: was unaware of def's in-custody status.  Off the record 11:36 AM for breakout room.  Back on the record, 11:44 AM, same appearances as previously noted.  Atty Chapman updates- ready to proceed with the plea hearing.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Def pleading to Count 3: OAR for court cost recommendation; DRI all remaining counts.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 3 and orders a JOC; remaining counts are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders: $200 DNA surcharge, waives all other costs.  $25/month until paid in full.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff.
Employment terminated voluntarily 9/16/22

2:00 PM Called 22CF22 scheduled for PH.  Defendant Melinda Joy Juleen in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Melinda Joy Juleen.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All appeared in person.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information which mirrors the criminal complaint.  Attny Chapman ready to set a PLEAS date.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Proposed income assignment order (attorney fees)
on Petition for Appointment of and Attorney
to def re: CAA

records.addlTxt: 2:01 PM Called 22CF22 scheduled for PH.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melinda Joy Juleen in court without an attny today, just applied for a court appointed attorney.  Def would like an attny and before a PH hearing.  Court has reviewed application.  State notes Trooper is appearing by zoom, witness is available to proceed today, but with application for attny sees the need to reschedule.  Has been reset numerous times.  Def on Huber from Polk Co.  PH's are generally in person.  Court notes def will need to act promptly on the attny.  Def owns home and land.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court notes no attorney on record.  Def thought Attorney on Polk Co case would be here too, def to contact Spooner PD's office to retain an attorney on her Burnett County case.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG to misdemanors entered.  WTLPH.  Def intends to apply for PD.
